CashFlow Goal Tracker
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (json, datetime, hashlib, os, sys).
- Tracks income/expenses against monthly savings goals with progress visualization.
- Data persists in 'cashflow.json' (auto-create if missing): list of dicts with keys: date (ISO), type ('income'/'expense'), amount (float), category (str), description (str), goal_month (YYYY-MM).
- Main menu (keyboard-only): 1=Add transaction, 2=View summary, 3=Set goal, 4=Print report, 5=Share hash, 6=Quit (loop until quit).
- Add transaction: prompt date (YYYY-MM-DD or today), type, amount (>0), category (prompt from ['Food','Rent','Salary','Fun','Other']), desc; validate inputs with try/except.
- Set goal: prompt month (YYYY-MM), target savings (float >0); store in json under 'goals' dict.
- View summary: show current month totals (income, expenses, net, % to goal if set); list all txns by month grouped; ASCII bar chart for categories (e.g., Food: ##### 45%, scale to 50 chars).
- Print report: generate text summary (totals, top categories, goal progress) formatted for console copy-paste/print; use fixed-width columns.
- Share hash: compute SHA256 hash of json data (url-safe base64, 8 chars); display "Share: cashflow.app/#<hash>" for bookmark/sync.
- Keyboard-first: all via input(), arrow keys ignored (console), tab-complete categories via simple prefix match.
- Current month auto-detects from datetime.date.today().
- Error handling: invalid inputs reprompt, file locks prevented via atomic json write (temp file + rename).
- Testable: start empty, add 3 income/5 expenses, set goal 1000, verify summary/net/bar; hash stable for same data.
